main event: A circular, glowing object estimated at 50-60 feet in diameter was observed hovering over a cornfield near Hamlet, Indiana for 10-15 minutes before rising vertically and disappearing.
interesting points: The object had a domed top and emitted a reddish-orange glow around the edge.
It was observed by two calm and rational witnesses, Mr. and Mrs. Glenn Sowder, who were driving on a country road.
No unusual physical effects on the witnesses or the environment were reported.
A separate report describes the crash of a damaged aircraft in a field near Hamlet, Indiana around the same time, but it is unclear if the two incidents are related.
The sighting was ultimately determined to be UNIDENTIFIED after investigation.
sighted object: circular, glowing object 50-60 feet in diameter
